reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Improving the Socio Economic Status of Rural Women in Grand Cape Mount

description.narrative: Women in rural Grand Cape Mount County have often little or no formal education or productive skills and therefore do not find employment opportunities. There are very little opportunities for generating investment capital or engaging in any productive/inc ome generating ventures. Moreover, outdated, unproductive and environmental destructive practices have led to low productivity which doesn?tenable new investment.The objective of the project is to enhance the socio-economic development of rural women in G rand Cape Mount County.This objective will be achieved through improving vegetable production skills, basic literacy and numeracy, enhancement of management and business skills, and ensuring the participation of rural women in the governance and decision m aking processes at local level.Expected results/impacts: increased income generation opportunities, basic literacy skills of project participants developed and able to conduct business on their own, livelihood systems of project and non-project communities improved, increased women?s participation in the governance and decision making processes.Summary of activities that will be considered during the implementation of the project are: conducting entry point meetings with community authorities and stakeholde rs, conducting baseline study on the socio-economic status of beneficiaries, provision of basic literacy and numeracy training, training in improved crop production techniques, management and basic business skills, supply of assorted farming tools to proje ct beneficiaries, transforming existing project facility/farm into training and production facility.Rights-holders/beneficiaries: Rural women Implementing partner: Sustainable Livelihood Promoter Programme (SLPP)
